conclusion: Use properties of an ideal gas and principles of thermodynamics to solve the problem.
Cycle ABCDA involves changes in volume and pressure affecting temperature.
Temperature at each state is related to internal energy and gas constant.
Identify given quantities: P1, P2, V1, V2, T0.
Internal energy U of ideal gas is constant during the cycle.
Change in internal energy ΔU = UC - UA.
Using first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
Since gas is isothermal, ΔU = 0, therefore UC = UA.
Internal energy U related to temperature T by U = nRT.
T0 is the initial temperature at state A.
Temperature at state C will also be T0.
Temperature at state C is the same as initial temperature T0.
The temperature of State C is T0.
